Class BarcodeWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.awt.image.BufferedImage,java.lang.String>
      • BarcodeWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.awt.image.BufferedImage>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.awt.image.BufferedImage>

    public class BarcodeWorker
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.awt.image.BufferedImage,java.lang.String>
    This class imports images, generates a barcode from them, and saves the barcode. It inherits from SwingWorker in order to run in the background.

    SwingWorker elements based on: http://www.javacreed.com/swing-worker-example/

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Kirk

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.SwingWorker

        javax.swing.SwingWorker.StateValue

    • Method Detail

      • loadImagesFromFolder

        public void loadImagesFromFolder(java.lang.String folderPath)
        This method loads an unordered set of images from a folder and its subfolders. It accepts only JPGs and PNGs, and stores them in imgList.
        Parameters:
        folderPath - This is the path for the folder containing images to be loaded

      • loadImagesChronologically

        public void loadImagesChronologically(java.lang.String folderPath,
                                      java.lang.String jsonPath)
        This method loads an ordered set of images as described by the media.json file provided by Instagram image downloads. It assumes that the relative paths provided by that file are correct, so it will only work when folderPath is the root folder for the download (usually named "username_dateDownloaded")
        Parameters:
        folderPath - The root folder of the Instagram data download
        jsonPath - The path to the media.json file

      • averageAll

        public void averageAll()
        This method runs the averageColor function on all images in imgList and adds them to an internal variable avgColorList.

      • adjustHSB

        public void adjustHSB(java.lang.Double hue,
                      java.lang.Double saturation,
                      java.lang.Double brightness)
        This method modifies the colors in avgColorList according to the HSB color model. All parameters are values between 0 and 1, and for now there is no input sanitization.
        Parameters:
        hue - The new hue for all colors--if null, hues are not adjusted
        saturation - The new saturation for all colors--if null saturations are not adjusted
        brightness - The new brightness for all color--if null, hues are not adjusted

      • createBarcode

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage createBarcode(java.lang.String savePath,
                                                  int stripeWidth,
                                                  int imgHeight)
        This method generates and saves the barcode in PNG format using the colors currently saved in avgColorList.
        Parameters:
        savePath - The location for the saved barcode image
        stripeWidth - The width of each bar in the barcode, in pixels
        imgHeight - The height of the barcode, in pixels
        Returns:
        BufferedImage The completed barcode, in a renderable form

      • sortAvgColorList

        public boolean sortAvgColorList(java.lang.String sortVar)
        This method sorts the avgColorList by hue, saturation, or brightness, in decreasing order.
        Parameters:
        sortVar - The type of sort to be executed. Currently supports "hue", "saturation", and "brightness"
        Returns:
        boolean True if input was a valid sort parameter, or false otherwise
